channel.title: RPG Roundtable
channel.itunes:summary: The RPG Roundtable Podcast is a monthly discussing, bringing together RPG podcasters to discuss common issues in the table-top RPG hobby.

item.title: RPGRT003
item.dc:creator: Stu
item.description: RPGRT003 – Noteworthy NPCs In this episode we discuss what makes NPCs in table top RPGs notable and memorable. Your hosts: Liz and Mike from the Nearly Enough Dice Podcast. Branden from the Saving the Game Podcast. Stu from Happy … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
RPGRT003 – Noteworthy NPCs

In this episode we discuss what makes NPCs in table top RPGs notable and memorable.

Your hosts:

Liz and Mike from the Nearly Enough Dice Podcast.

Branden from the Saving the Game Podcast.

Stu from Happy Jacks RPG Podcast.

The RPG Roundtable is a monthly podcast featuring RPG podcasters from around the world discussing various topics about the table-top RPG hobby, to help hone GM and player skill and improve the gaming experience.

If you are an RPG Podcast host and would like to join a future roundtable, please ask for an invitation to our Google+ RPG Podcasters Community, which is where this podcast is organized.

item.title: RPGRT002 The RPG Roundtable Podcast – When the GM should say ‘yes.’
item.dc:creator: Stu
item.description: RPGRT002 – When the GM should say ‘yes.’ Your hosts: Stu from Happy Jacks RPG Podcast. Jim Ryan from Crucible of Realms Podcast andTransmissions from the Ninth World. Christopher from Idle Red Hands. Kevin from The Walking Eye Podcast. We discuss the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
RPGRT002 – When the GM should say ‘yes.’

Your hosts:

Stu from Happy Jacks RPG Podcast.

Jim Ryan from Crucible of Realms Podcast andTransmissions from the Ninth World.

Christopher from Idle Red Hands.

Kevin from The Walking Eye Podcast.

We discuss the concept of “yes, and” in the table-top RPG hobby and player contributions to the narrative.

The RPG Roundtable is a monthly podcast featuring RPG podcasters from around the world discussing various topics about the table-top RPG hobby, to help hone GM and player skill and improve the gaming experience.

If you are an RPG Podcast host and would like to join a future roundtable, please ask for an invitation to our Google+ RPG Podcasters Community, which is where this podcast is organized.

item.title: RPGRT001 The RPG Roundtable Podcast – Roleplaying Reward Mechanics
item.dc:creator: Stu
item.description: RPGRT001 – Roleplaying Reward Mechanics Your hosts: Stu Venable from Happy Jacks RPG Podcast. Erik Carl from Metagamers Anonymous. Grant Woodward from Saving the Game. Jim Ryan from Crucible of Realms Podcast and Transmissions from the Ninth World. In this … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
RPGRT001 – Roleplaying Reward Mechanics

Your hosts:

Stu Venable from Happy Jacks RPG Podcast.
Erik Carl from Metagamers Anonymous.
Grant Woodward from Saving the Game.
Jim Ryan from Crucible of Realms Podcast and Transmissions from the Ninth World.

In this the first episode of the RPG Roundtable Pocast, we discuss role-playing reward mechanics, such as bennnies in Savage Worlds, fate points in FATE and experience points as a reward mechanic in games like L5R and DnD.

We talk about the goals of RP reward mechanics, how they get used in real life and how to use them better.

RPG Roundtable is a monthly RPG podcast, bring together RPG podcasters to discuss common issues in the hobby. If you host or produce an RPG podcast, and you would like to participate in a future roundtable, ask to join our Google+ group.

item.itunes:summary:
RPGRT001 - Roleplaying Reward Mechanics
Your hosts:
Stu Venable from Happy Jacks RPG Podcast. Erik Carl from Metagamers Anonymous. Grant Woodward from Saving the Game. Jim Ryan from Crucible of Realms Podcast and Transmissions from the Ninth World.
In this the first episode of the RPG Roundtable Pocast, we discuss role-playing reward mechanics, such as bennnies in Savage Worlds, fate points in FATE and experience points as a reward mechanic in games like L5R and DnD.
We talk about the goals of RP reward mechanics, how they get used in real life and how to use them better.
RPG Roundtable is a monthly RPG podcast, bring together RPG podcasters to discuss common issues in the hobby. If you host or produce an RPG podcast, and you would like to participate in a future roundtable, ask to join our Google+ group.
